    • Constructor Detail

      • LabelPointStyle

        public LabelPointStyle​(java.lang.String text,
                       int textColor,
                       int bgColor,
                       LabelPointStyle.ScrollMode mode)
        Creates a new label style, centered on the point at the default system size with a relative rotation of 0f (right side up).
        Parameters:
        text - The label text
        textColor - The text color
        bgColor - The background color for the text (0 for no background)
        mode - The auto-scrolling mode to use for the label

      • LabelPointStyle

        public LabelPointStyle​(java.lang.String text,
                       int textColor,
                       int bgColor,
                       LabelPointStyle.ScrollMode mode,
                       float textSize,
                       int alignX,
                       int alignY,
                       float rotation,
                       boolean rotationAbsolute)
        Creates a new label style with the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        text - The label text
        textColor - The text color
        bgColor - The background color for the text (0 for no background)
        mode - The auto-scrolling mode to use for the label
        textSize - The text size (in points). A value of 0.0f indicates that the default system setting should be used. At this time textSize is not honored and it will always be the default value.
        alignX - The horizontal alignment of the label. Less than 0 for to the left, 0 for horizontally centered, greater than 0 for to the right
        alignY - The vertical alignment of the label. Less than 0 for above, 0 for vertically centered, greater than 0 for below
        rotation - The rotation of the label, in degrees counter-clockwise
        rotationAbsolute - true if the rotation is absolute (relative to North), false if the rotation is relative.

      • LabelPointStyle

        public LabelPointStyle​(java.lang.String text,
                       int textColor,
                       int bgColor,
                       LabelPointStyle.ScrollMode mode,
                       float textSize,
                       int alignX,
                       int alignY,
                       float rotation,
                       boolean rotationAbsolute,
                       double minRenderResolution)
        Creates a new label style with the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        text - The label text
        textColor - The text color
        bgColor - The background color for the text (0 for no background)
        mode - The auto-scrolling mode to use for the label
        textSize - The text size (in points). A value of 0.0f indicates that the default system setting should be used. At this time textSize is not honored and it will always be the default value.
        alignX - The horizontal alignment of the label. Less than 0 for to the left, 0 for horizontally centered, greater than 0 for to the right
        alignY - The vertical alignment of the label. Less than 0 for above, 0 for vertically centered, greater than 0 for below
        rotation - The rotation of the label, in degrees counter-clockwise
        rotationAbsolute - true if the rotation is absolute (relative to North), false if the rotation is relative.
        minRenderResolution - The minimum render resolution for the label.

      • LabelPointStyle

        public LabelPointStyle​(java.lang.String text,
                       int textColor,
                       int bgColor,
                       LabelPointStyle.ScrollMode mode,
                       float textSize,
                       int alignX,
                       int alignY,
                       float rotation,
                       boolean rotationAbsolute,
                       double minRenderResolution,
                       float scale)
        Creates a new label style with the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        text - The label text
        textColor - The text color
        bgColor - The background color for the text (0 for no background)
        mode - The auto-scrolling mode to use for the label
        textSize - The text size (in points). A value of 0.0f indicates that the default system setting should be used. At this time textSize is not honored and it will always be the default value.
        alignX - The horizontal alignment of the label. Less than 0 for to the left, 0 for horizontally centered, greater than 0 for to the right
        alignY - The vertical alignment of the label. Less than 0 for above, 0 for vertically centered, greater than 0 for below
        rotation - The rotation of the label, in degrees counter-clockwise
        rotationAbsolute - true if the rotation is absolute (relative to North), false if the rotation is relative.
        minRenderResolution - The minimum render resolution for the label.
        scale - The scale to be applied to the label. 1.0f is unscaled

      • LabelPointStyle

        public LabelPointStyle​(java.lang.String text,
                       int textColor,
                       int bgColor,
                       LabelPointStyle.ScrollMode mode,
                       float textSize,
                       float offsetX,
                       float offsetY,
                       int alignX,
                       int alignY,
                       float rotation,
                       boolean rotationAbsolute,
                       double minRenderResolution,
                       float scale)
        Creates a new label style with the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        text - The label text
        textColor - The text color
        bgColor - The background color for the text (0 for no background)
        mode - The auto-scrolling mode to use for the label
        textSize - The text size (in points). A value of 0.0f indicates that the default system setting should be used. At this time textSize is not honored and it will always be the default value.
        offsetX - The horizontal offset for the label in pixels
        offsetY - The vertical offset for the label in pixels
        alignX - The horizontal alignment of the label. Less than 0 for to the left, 0 for horizontally centered, greater than 0 for to the right
        alignY - The vertical alignment of the label. Less than 0 for above, 0 for vertically centered, greater than 0 for below
        rotation - The rotation of the label, in degrees counter-clockwise
        rotationAbsolute - true if the rotation is absolute (relative to North), false if the rotation is relative.
        minRenderResolution - The minimum render resolution for the label.
        scale - The scale to be applied to the label. 1.0f is unscaled

      • LabelPointStyle

        public LabelPointStyle​(java.lang.String text,
                       int textColor,
                       int bgColor,
                       LabelPointStyle.ScrollMode mode,
                       java.lang.String fontFace,
                       float textSize,
                       java.util.EnumSet<LabelPointStyle.Style> fontStyle,
                       float offsetX,
                       float offsetY,
                       int alignX,
                       int alignY,
                       float rotation,
                       boolean rotationAbsolute,
                       double minRenderResolution,
                       float scale)
        Creates a new label style with the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        text - The label text
        textColor - The text color
        bgColor - The background color for the text (0 for no background)
        mode - The auto-scrolling mode to use for the label
        fontFace - The font face name, or null for the default font.
        textSize - The text size (in points). A value of 0.0f indicates that the default system setting should be used. At this time textSize is not honored and it will always be the default value.
        fontStyle - The font style
        offsetX - The horizontal offset for the label in pixels
        offsetY - The vertical offset for the label in pixels
        alignX - The horizontal alignment of the label. Less than 0 for to the left, 0 for horizontally centered, greater than 0 for to the right
        alignY - The vertical alignment of the label. Less than 0 for above, 0 for vertically centered, greater than 0 for below
        rotation - The rotation of the label, in degrees counter-clockwise
        rotationAbsolute - true if the rotation is absolute (relative to North), false if the rotation is relative.
        minRenderResolution - The minimum render resolution for the label.
        scale - The scale to be applied to the label. 1.0f is unscaled

    • Method Detail

      • getTextColor

        public int getTextColor()
        Returns the color to be modulated with the text. Each pixel value in the label is multiplied by the returned color; a value of 0xFFFFFFFF should be used to render the label using its original color.
        Returns:
        The label color.

      • getBackgroundColor

        public int getBackgroundColor()
        Returns the color to be for the background of the text. If 0, no background is drawn.
        Returns:
        The background color.

      • getScrollMode

        public LabelPointStyle.ScrollMode getScrollMode()
        Returns the auto-scroll mode for the label.
        Returns:
        The auto-scroll mode for the label

      • getLabelRotation

        public float getLabelRotation()
        Returns the rotation to be applied to the label. The value of isRotationAbsolute() should be evaluated to correctly interpret the rotation value.
        Returns:
        The rotation of the label, in radians counter-clockwise.
        See Also:
        isRotationAbsolute()

      • isRotationAbsolute

        public boolean isRotationAbsolute()
        Returns true if the rotation is absolute (relative to North) or false if the rotation is relative.
        Returns:
        true if the rotation is absolute (relative to North) or false if the rotation is relative.

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Returns the text string for the label.
        Returns:

      • getLabelAlignmentX

        public int getLabelAlignmentX()
        Returns the horizontal alignment for the label. A value of less-than 0 indicates to the left of the point, a value of 0 is horizontally centered on the point and a value greater than 0 indicates to the right of the point.
        Returns:
        The horizontal alignment for the label with respect to the point.

      • getLabelAlignmentY

        public int getLabelAlignmentY()
        Returns the vertical alignment for the label. A value of less-than 0 indicates above the point, a value of 0 is centered vertically on the point and a value greater than 0 indicates below the point.
        Returns:
        The vertical alignment for the label with respect to the point.

      • getTextSize

        public float getTextSize()
        Returns the text size of the label, in points. A value of 0.0f indicates the default system setting.
        Returns:
        The text size of the label, in points.

      • getLabelMinRenderResolution

        public double getLabelMinRenderResolution()
        Returns the label render scale to be applied to the label.
        Returns:
        The render scale to to be applied to the label.

      • getLabelScale

        public float getLabelScale()
        Returns the scaling factor to be applied to the rendering of the label.
        Returns:
        The render scaling factor for the label

      • getOffsetX

        public float getOffsetX()
        Returns the vertical offset to be applied to the rendering of the label.
        Returns:
        The vertical offset for the label with respect to the point in pixels

      • getOffsetY

        public float getOffsetY()
        Returns the horizontal offset to be applied to the rendering of the label.
        Returns:
        The horizontal offset for the label with respect to the point in pixels

      • getFontFace

        public java.lang.String getFontFace()
        Returns the font face name for the label.
        Returns:
        The font face name

      • getStyle

        public java.util.EnumSet<LabelPointStyle.Style> getStyle()
        Returns the set of style flags for the label.
        Returns:
        The set of style flags
